form_title: AI Visibility Audit: Brand Information Questionnaire
description: This questionnaire gathers key details needed to assess your brand’s AI visibility and representation across answer engines like ChatGPT, Perplexity, Copilot, Google AI Overview, and Gemini. Each field maps directly to an internal QWIKI entity.

fields.question: What is your official brand name? Please provide the full and official name of your brand as you wish it to be represented in all AI responses.
What is your primary business description? Briefly describe your core business. Example: 'Leading multinational insurance company' or 'Cloud-based CRM software provider.'
What is your primary industry / market category? Which main sector or industry do you operate in? Example: 'UK Home Insurance', 'B2B SaaS', 'Automotive'.
What is your brand’s overall reputation & perception? Describe how your brand is generally viewed in the market—mention any known positive, negative, or misunderstood points.
What was your brand’s founding date? Approximate year your brand was founded or established.
What are your key awards & recognitions? List major awards, certifications, or recognitions (with year and awarding body, if possible).
What is the approximate size of your company? (e.g., '250 employees', 'Mid-sized', 'Enterprise', etc.)
Where is your headquarters located? (City, Country)
What is your brand mission statement? (Optional but helps clarify trust and authority signals.)
What is your brand vision statement? (Optional—how do you want your brand to be known or remembered?)
What is the official website and other key online properties? Include your main website, blog, newsroom, etc.
What are your official social media profiles? (e.g., LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, YouTube—provide links.)
What is your focus offering name? The exact name of the product or service you want audited (e.g., 'Home Insurance', 'SalesCloud', 'Model 3').
What is the general product/service type? Describe the category: e.g., 'home insurance policy', 'CRM software', 'electric car'.
What are your key offerings/features? List the standout features and unique selling points of this product/service.
What is the typical pricing structure? Outline the general pricing, tiers, or plans. Ballpark figures are fine unless specific prices are public.
Are there any known limitations or drawbacks? Note any known issues, drawbacks, or criticisms regarding this product/service.
How frequently is this product/service updated or improved? (e.g., 'monthly', 'quarterly', 'ad-hoc', or specify release cadence.)
What are your primary target audience(s)? Describe the ideal user or buyer (e.g., 'homeowners in rural UK', 'small businesses', 'first-time buyers').
What core problems does your offering solve? State the main problems your product/service addresses and the outcomes/benefits for users.
Are there specific use cases or scenarios? Mention any niche or high-value use cases where your product/service excels.
Who are your top 2–3 direct competitors for this offering? List your brand’s main direct competitors for this product/service.
What are their comparable product/service names? List the direct names of competitors’ offerings, if known (e.g., 'Allianz Home Insurance').
What are your key differentiators from competitors? Explain the most important reasons for customers to choose you over these specific competitors.
What are the key review platforms for your brand or offering? List independent review sites you monitor, e.g., Trustpilot, G2, Capterra, or industry-specific platforms.
Where do you publish official news or updates? Specify where you post official news, product updates, or company announcements (e.g., newsroom, blog, site section).
What are your main thought leadership or educational resources? Share links to whitepapers, research, guides, or FAQs you provide as authoritative industry resources.
